byline.contributor: Deepak Adhikari contributed reporting from Biratnagar, Nepal, and Bhadra Sharma from Kathmandu, Nepal.

abstract: Human Rights Watch report offers details about number of instances of grisly violence involving protesters that took place in Terai region of Nepal as lawmakers prepared country's Constitution.
lead_paragraph: The report by Human Rights Watch said 25 people had been killed in the southern Terai region, where there were protests against the new Constitution.

headline.main: Report on Nepal Protests Details Grisly Violence
headline.print_headline: Report on Protests Against Nepal’s New Constitution Details Grisly Violence

snippet: The report by Human Rights Watch said 25 people had been killed in the southern Terai region, where there were protests against the new Constitution.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
